Posts.Content: I'm now 4.5 years post prostatectomy and finally decided to have an artificial sphincter installed. 4 weeks ago had the surgery. Activation in 2 weeks. No infection. I do have a lot of neuropathy in my scrotum - numbness surrounded by severe pain at the edges of the numb areas. Doc says that should go away. I also have a good deal of pain where the resevior is just below the skin. I can feel it there so know that's where it is. Anyone else had this? Pains sound familiar? Did they go away?
Posts.Signature: Gary Initial PSA 24.8. Jan 08 Biopsy Mar 08. 12 cores. 7 positive. Gleason 8 [4+4] Radical Retropubic Prostatectomy 04/29/08 Diagnosed mucinous adenocarcinoma Positive margins show in slides PSA 0.0 8 weeks after surgery Bilateral Inguinal Hernia Repairs 7/10/08 PSA 0.02 Oct 08 PSA 0.04 Dec 08 PSA 0.06 Mar 09 PSA 0.04 Apr 09 PSA 0.07 Jul 09 PSA 0.15 Oct 09 PSA 0.17 Jan 10 PSA 0.30 Apr 10 PSA 0.71 Dec 10 PSA 0.69 Mar 11 PSA 0.90 Oct 11 PSA 1.16 Mar 12 PSA 1.96 Sep 25

Posts.Title: Artificial Sphincter

Posts.Content: You can see me stats in my .sig. Doc salvaged one nerve 100%. The othern was involved but Doc removed only oinvolved section[s] in hope of future regeneration. Right now I'm severely sleep deprived from incontinence. Any ideas to east this would be appreciated. Now to the crux; My pathology shows 'mucinois adrenal carcinoma' of the prostate. It is ADT resistant and there are supposedly only 46 cases known [47 now]. No stats to go on for predictive behavgior. No drugs being researched due to no market. I go back in a week foir a CT [What for? I dunno.] Two weeks later my first post RP PSA. Nat. Cancer Soc. is researching thid for me and maybe somewhere there is a agood trial going on, I'm exhausted - more later.

Posts.Title: 3 weeks post-retropubic RP

Posts.Content: I have two bits of news. 1) The urologist activated my artificial sphincter yesterday and it works great. There is, however, the issue of sitting down. When the cuff is inflated I sit smack on top of it and BOY does it hurt after a few minutes. Sitting on it also makes it work less effectively and if I squirm I leak a bit. A donut on my seat solves the problem. Its a small price to pay for not having to wear pads anymore. 2) My doubling rate hit the 1 year mark with yesterday's PSA test. I'm going to have conversations with my urologist and with an 'alternative therapist' he is recommending. I have refused radiation. I will likely refuse chemo unless they can offer some strong reasons not to. I don't want ATD, but have a responsibility to my family and to my congregation, so if it comes down to that I'll likely take it. Question: Are there any other post-prostatectomy therapies that have hit the mainstream in the last 4.5 years since my surgery? A discussion beyond simple names of therapies would be welcome.

Posts.Title: Doubling Rate 1 yr and Artificial Sphincter

Posts.Content: True, I have refused radiation and would not have had the sphincter installed had I planned on going that route. Radiation and artificial sphincter are, as far as I have learned from listening to my urologist, not compatible. ADT just sounds so distasteful, yet it is apparently my best, next option. Its interesting to note that my urologist has suggested that the rapid rise in my latest PSA may be a result of my sphincter surgery. Thanks for your input on other followups. Some I knew but others are new to me. Good fodder for investigation. I will continue to report in as I progress so others have another point of comparison - though certainly not a 'route-to-follow'. Every man's PC is different and everyone's journey takes different turns. Blessings,
